meanings.sent1: The stemmy branches intertwined in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The gardener removed the stemmy weeds from the flower bed.
meanings.sent3: The stemmy vines played tug-of-war with the fence.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was a tangle of stemmy strands after the windy walk.
meanings.sent5: The stemmy texture of the plant felt rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: Having a strong or prominent stem
meanings.sent1: The tree stood tall with its stemmy trunk reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent2: The stemmy oak tree provided shade on hot summer days.
meanings.sent3: The stemmy cactus looked like a miniature tree in the desert.
meanings.sent4: His stemmy arms lifted the heavy load effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The stemmy plant swayed gracefully in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a stem
meanings.sent1: The stemmy texture of the fabric made it durable.
meanings.sent2: The stemmy structure of the building supported its weight.
meanings.sent3: The stemmy design of the vase added a rustic touch to the room.
meanings.sent4: Her stemmy voice carried through the auditorium.
meanings.sent5: The stemmy appearance of the plant indicated its health.
